name: girl death
description:
The moon bathed the cold parquet floor
Milky and smooth wave.
Pressing a bouquet to my hot cheek,
I was dozing sweetly under the moon.

I am doubly disturbed by radiance and sleep,
I opened my sleepy eyes,
And the girl-death leaned towards me,
Like a pink angel without wings.

A medallion trembles on a thin neck,
A blush flows down her cheeks,
And you can see she was running: a little dusty
Her blue shoe.

Intricate pattern of golden fringe,
There is a turquoise thread in the curls.
"You are a little boy, I am a girl: we
We'll be naughty on the way.

Put on (you are a knight) my lace scarf! "
I silently handed her a bouquet…
Milky and smooth, cold wave
The moon washed the parquet floor.
